body.p: Dictionaries are versatile data structures in Python used to store key-value pairs. They are commonly used for representing structured data and mapping relationships between items.

section.title: Example
section.codeblock: # Example of dictionaries my_dict = {"name": "John", "age": 30, "city": "New York"} print(my_dict["name"]) # Output: John print(my_dict.get("age")) # Output: 30
